item.title: More than 21.7M COVID-19 cases worldwide, death toll at 770,429 with about 13.3M recoveries
item.description: At least 21,719,870 cases of coronavirus have been registered in 196 countries and territories. Of these, at least 13,399,500 are now considered recovered. The novel coronavirus killed at least 770,429 people since the outbreak emerged in China last December, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Monday.

item.title: In COVID-19 address, Duterte rants against human rights advocates anew
item.description: “Kayong mga Pilipino, everyday you see drug cases either busted, arrested, killed, and running into millions ang amount. Makita ninyo sa inyong telebisyon. Napakatorpe naman nitong human rights… Magbilang lang kayo ng patay? Eh p****ina ninyo maglipat kayo ng trabaho, wag sa human rights,” Duterte said in his nationally-televised address.

item.title: Lolo sa Mindoro, pumayag kayang palitan ng surgical mask ang kaniyang face mask na gawa sa bao?
item.description: Marami ang humanga sa 70-anyos na lolong magsasaka sa Oriental Mindoro dahil sa naisip niyang gawing face mask at face shield ang bao ng niyog. Pero ayon sa mga eksperto, hindi ito ligtas na panlaban sa COVID-19.

item.title: New global temperature record set in California's Death Valley
item.description: The hottest air temperature recorded anywhere on the planet in at least a century, and possibly ever, was reached in Death Valley in California's Mojave Desert on Sunday afternoon where it soared to 130 Fahrenheit (54.4 Celsius).

item.title: Mga matres sa isang quarantine facility sa Pampanga, na-takehome ng ilang pinag-quarantine doon
item.description: Laking gulat ng namamahala sa isang quarantine facility sa Guagua, Pampanga nang madiskubre nilang nawawala ang 10 matres o higaan na tinutuluyan ng mga PUMs o persons under monitoring sa COVID-19.

item.title: Leaders always stay where the crisis is, Duterte says from Davao
item.description: A leader must always stay where the crisis is and not abandon his people during a time of need, President Rodrigo Duterte said Monday night as he gave his latest coronavirus briefing from Davao.

item.title: Metro Manila at ilang kalapit na lalawigan, balik-GCQ na
item.description: Inaprubahan ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte ang rekomendasyon ng Inter-Agency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Diseases na ibalik na sa general community quarantine o GCQ ang Metro Manila at ilan pang kalapit nitong mga lalawigan.

item.title: Areas under GCQ, MGCQ to stop spread of COVID-19
item.description: On the recommendation of the Inter-Agency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Diseases, President Rodrigo Duterte placed the following under general community quarantine until August 31, 2020.

item.title: What if scientists fail to develop a COVID-19 vaccine?
item.description: Scientists around the world are racing to find a vaccine for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). However, it is also possible that none of the candidate vaccines will be found effective. According to GMA Network s resident analyst Richard Heydarian, there are other courses of action that may be taken in the absence of a vaccine.

item.title: NCR, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal back to GCQ, says Duterte
item.description: Duterte said the following areas will be under GCQ:Metro Manila, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal, Nueva Ecija, Batangas, Quezon, Iloilo City, Cebu City, Lapu-Lapu City, Mandaue City, Talisay City in Cebu, and the municipalities of Minglanilla and Consolacion. The rest of the country will be under modified GCQ.

item.title: Mystery no more: Spain's ex-king Juan Carlos has been in UAE since Aug. 3
item.description: Former Spanish king Juan Carlos, who left Spain under a cloud of scandal, has been in the United Arab Emirates since Aug. 3, a royal household spokesman said on Monday, putting an end to an international guessing game over the 82-year-old's whereabouts.

item.title: Philippines to pay for vaccines vs. COVID-19, says Duterte
item.description: The Philippines will pay for the vaccines that will be made available to Filipinos by Russia and China, President Rodrigo Duterte said on Monday.

item.title: Former Spanish king Juan Carlos is in UAE --royal palace
item.description: Juan Carlos, the former king of Spain who went into exile this month in the face of graft allegations, is in the United Arab Emirates, the royal palace said Monday, ending the mystery on his whereabouts.

item.title: DOH denies restricting labs from releasing COVID-19 test results
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) on Monday refuted a statement by Philippine Red Cross chief Senator Richard Gordon that laboratories are not allowed to release positive test results for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) to the concerned individuals.

item.title: 8 OFWs sa HK na lumabag daw sa social distancing, pinagmulta tig-HK$2,000
item.description: Pinagmulta ang walong overseas Filipino workers sa Hong Kong dahil sa paglabag daw nila sa social distancing protocols sa Central District noong Agosto 9.
